action.action-desc: Ms. Titus introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means, and in addition to the Committees on Energy and Commerce and Education and the Workforce, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to expand the Saver’s credit, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Helping Americans Save Act of 2015.

paragraph.text: Section 25B(b)(1) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended—

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (A) by striking $30,000 and inserting $50,000,
in subparagraph (B) by striking $30,000 but not over $32,500 and inserting $50,000 but not over $60,000,
in subparagraph (C) by striking $32,500 but not over $50,000 and inserting $60,000 but not over $70,000, and
in subparagraph (D) by striking $50,000 and inserting $70,000.

paragraph.text: Section 25B(b)(3) of such Code is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking 2006 in the matter preceding subparagraph (A) and inserting 2015, and
by striking 2005 in subparagraph (B) thereof and inserting 2014.

subsection.header: Adjustment of credit amount for inflation
subsection.text: Section 25B(a) of such Code is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking In the case of and inserting the following:
by adding at the end the following:
In the case of any taxable year beginning in a calendar year after 2015, the $2,000 amount contained in paragraph (1) shall be increased by an amount equal to—

subparagraph.text: such dollar amount, multiplied by

the cost-of-living adjustment determined under section 1(f)(3) for the calendar year in which the taxable year begins, determined by substituting calendar year 2014 for calendar year 1992 in subparagraph (B) thereof.

paragraph.continuation-text: Any increase determined under the preceding sentence shall be rounded to the nearest multiple of $50.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2014.

section.header: Retirement contributions and savings disregarded for certain means-tested programs

subsection.text: Section 408(a) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 608(a)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.header: Disregard of certain retirement accounts and contributions
paragraph.text: In determining the eligibility of an individual for assistance, or the amount of assistance payable to an individual, under a State program funded under this part, the State shall disregard any amount contributed by the individual to, and the value of—

subparagraph.text: any funds in a plan, contract, or account, described in sections 401(a), 403(a), 403(b), 408, 408A, 457(b), and 501(c)(18) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 and any funds in a Federal Thrift Savings Plan account as provided in section 8439 of title 5, United States Code;
any retirement program or account included in any successor or similar provision that may be enacted and determined to be exempt from tax under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986; and
any other retirement plans, contracts, or accounts (as determined by the Secretary of Health and Human Services).

paragraph.text: Section 1612(b) of such Act (42 U.S.C. 1382a(b)) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking ; and at the end of paragraph (25);
by striking the period at the end of paragraph (26) and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: any amount received by the individual, to the extent that the amount is contributed by the individual to a program, plan, contract, or account referred to in section 1613(a).
Section 1613(a) of such Act (42 U.S.C. 1382b(a)) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking ; and at the end of paragraph (16);
by striking the period at the end of paragraph (17) and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following:

any funds in a plan, contract, or account, described in sections 401(a), 403(a), 403(b), 408, 408A, 457(b), and 501(c)(18) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 and any funds in a Federal Thrift Savings Plan account as provided in section 8439 of title 5, United States Code;
any retirement program or account included in any successor or similar provision that may be enacted and determined to be exempt from tax under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986; and
any other retirement plans, contracts, or accounts (as determined by the Commissioner of Social Security).

subsection.text: There shall not be included in any determination under section 2605(b)(2)(B) of the Low-Income Home Energy Assistance Act of 1981 (42 U.S.C. 8624(b)(2)(B)) of household eligibility for Low-Income Home Energy Assistance Program funds, any amount contributed to, and the value of—

paragraph.text: any funds in a plan, contract, or account, described in sections 401(a), 403(a), 403(b), 408, 408A, 457(b), and 501(c)(18) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 and any funds in a Federal Thrift Savings Plan account as provided in section 8439 of title 5, United States Code;
any retirement program or account included in any successor or similar provision that may be enacted and determined to be exempt from tax under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986; and
any other retirement plans, contracts, or accounts (as determined by the Secretary of Health and Human Services).
